Понимаете, писать о Half-Life 2 в общепринятой манере — тщательно обсасывать все эти сюжеты, графики, звуки и музыки, обсуждать количество и интеллект монстровья, разглядывать пиксели в текстурах, пересчитывать все модели оружия и заниматься тому подобной привычной бухгалтерией — это как-то... нелепо, что ли. Какая, блин, разница — сколько здесь разновидностей гадов-вурдалаков и какой шейдерный эффект используется для реалистичной прорисовки воды? Все самые мелкие шестеренки этой игры работают как один большой механизм — на все сто, без единого сбоя и прокола. Поэтому описывать игру привычными нам критериями, по частям, в рамках “графика-звук-сюжет” по меньшей мере глупо.

It's like a...a.....Zombine...haha--_-.


Masterpiece.

Resolvi fazer essa analíse por motivos de... sei lá, mas vamos ao que interessa. Eu sempre fui uma pessoa que ouvia falar do grande meme da Valve nunca completar uma trilogia, e que sempre quiseram HL 3 e Portal 3, por quê essa galera quer tanto? Eu acabei iniciando pelo 2 porque sou desses, mas logo me contextualizei com as outras histórias e entendi melhor. O jogo é simplesmente sensacional, para os amantes de uma aventura longa (nem tanto), com quests, tiroteios, não tenha medo de bichos pregando na sua cabeça, HL é pra você. O jooj já é bastante antiguinho, e me sinto mal por ter apenas jogado ele agora, mas que final, ein. E não é que eu tenha levado sustos com os bichinhos do jogo, que isso, MAS TOME CUIDADO. O jogo vale a pena com qualquer preço, mas eu com certeza recomendo comprar numa sale, já que vem o pacote completo da Valve com um precinho que tu ganha vendendo cartas, então é isso, jogabilidade sensa, história sensa, e inimigos que pulam na sua cabeça sensacionais.

[h1][b][i][u]Half-Life 2 - 9/10[/u][/i][/b][/h1]

[u]Story[/u]
Half-Life 2 is an action and puzzle game set in Bulgaria. You start off on a train to City 17, being awoken from stasis by G-Man. Afterwards, you make your way to Dr Kleiner's lab to teleport to Eli. However, the teleporter malfunctions and you have to make your way back to City 17 by fighting antlions, combine soldiers, zombies, and more. You meet some interesting characters. They either help you out with killing or give you some new equipment. The game doesn't really get repetitive and it has a fantastic and entertaining story.

[u]Storyline Length[/u]
Being honest, it all depends on how you play. This could take you half an hour, it could take you three hours, six hours, a day, it all depends. I'm the type of person that's quick to solve puzzles and gets distracted by trying to do achievements. That being said, it took me about three or four hours because I kept on checking every corner for lambda caches.

[u]AI[/u]
I don't really understand why this game has a difficulty setting because the experience is the same. The AI is alright. They deal a bit of damage and will use everything at their disposal except for the cover. This applies to allies and enemies. Some AI is really annoying, like the headcrabs, and some are fairly scary like the striders. The AI is really accurate though, which makes all of them fairly scary to some point. Moving on from that, what's great is that the AI actually have facial expressions.

[u]Experience[/u]
The thing I love most about this game is that even though there's no time limit, your heart will be racing and your mind will be screaming to 'Just get it done before this or that happens!' The puzzles aren't very hard, but they're not very easy. They do require a bit more than a single brain cell. Another cool thing is no matter where you are, the right mood for that place will always hit you. In Ravenholm, you'll feel cautious and hurried before you even see any AI. In City 17, you'll feel relaxed but curious. It's fantastic! From the start to the end, you'll feel stress slowly building up. By the end, you are rushing to get the job done. Once you get to the end of the game, all the built-up stress will leave you and you can breathe normally again. I believe the right word for that is 'intense'.

[u]Graphics[/u]
Considering that this is a game from 2004, I was amazed the first time I loaded this game up. Almost every surface and material has a good amount of detail in it. Explosions and fire achieve what most games can't achieve today. They look threatening. They're the last thing you'd want to see in this game. Other than that, I'm impressed that this was made in 2004. At a quick glance, you'd assume it was from 2007 or 2008. There are great little details too. Shells fly out of the guns when you fire them, sparks of metal can be seen, and the blood can actually make you think [i]'Those poor people.'[/i]

[u]Sound[/u]
I think I'll end this novel of a review quite soon. Overall, enemies actually sound threatening and will make you stay away from them. Your footstep sounds change depending on what you're walking on, which is a great detail! Gunshots are actually quite loud, especially from your revolver or the striders. Voice acting is beautifully done, you can hear the emotion in their voices. However, Gordon remains mute.

[u]Overall[/u]
No Steam library is complete without this game. This is definitely one of the best games I have ever played and I would recommend it to quite literally almost anybody. For achievement hunters, this game would prove to be a little bit of a challenge. The lambda caches are cleverly hidden and some achievements are just tedious which is a great challenge.

[u]Specs[/u]
You won't need a very demanding computer, it's not that big of a game. I played this at 60fps and more throughout the entire game.

Intel Core i5-2500S @2.7Ghz
NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750 Ti
8GB RAM
Windows 7 (64 bit) Ultimate N

Great storyline, graphics for 2004 and sound! Would I buy it again? Yes. The gritty realism of City 17 reminds me of tv show “Colony” if anyone is watching that in 2017/2018. What I love about the game is how they were able to create a sense of place and mood every bit as good as the best cinema, human, light moments to off-set the depressing mood of City 17. The good - physics are enjoyable, masterful digital artwork, engaging original storyline, expressive facial expressions for NPCs, intense action. The bad – puzzles can become a little tedious after 2 or 3. How many times do you want to move some boxes/barrels to reach a window or uncover a hole in the floor? This game is so good you will be hungry for more! Please buy the game so we can have Half Life 3!
What else is to say? PLAY IT!

By far, this is my favorite game I've ever played, I mean that's not saying that much because I'm cheap so I play free games 99% of the time but this has the best gameplay ever. It feels so fun to play and once you play this you'll see why the half-life 3 is a meme. But the game also has a pretty good story except also has pretty liner levels but (in my opinion) is made up for with it's satifying gameplay and did I mention the enemies, the enemies are super fun to fight and the guns are satisfying to play especially the iconic gravity gun, this gun is so fun to play with. And if you really want a game that has this kind of gameplay but don't like the liner story levels then you might like gmod, but if you're like me you'll find nothing to do, you might play it for a few hours and then stop playing all togehter, but if you like just goofing around with a few friends in a game like half-life then gmod can be the game for you. But otherwise I rate half-life an 11/10.

Great game that deserves its reputation and place in the history of the industry. Still great fun to this day, although many of its innovations are standard practice now. I'd describe it as an environment-based shooter, with puzzle and exploration elements, although it is a linear game. How do you use your environment and the physics system of the game (which was amazing at the time of release) to kill combine and progress through the level? That's the bottom line of Half Life 2. I think the reason Valve never made Half Life 3 is that they want each game to innovate like the last one did, and there's simply no way for them to make Half Life 3 as impressive as it would need to be to follow up from this game.

I never actually got to complete this game start to finish until recently , because of different reasons . The game itself though is awesome , for its time it looks really pretty and the story is as intriguing as ever . I really like the way they made vehicles fit in the whole picture too ,but even the whole arsenal of guns you have is enough to bring a solid + to the diversity. Also the levels themselves are made in such way that the surroundings are changing so you won't get bored, but the change will fit in nicely , meaning that you won't ever feel it's out of context. If you're like me and somehow didn't get around finishing this game, I highly recommend that you play it :)

[h1]The short of it:[/h1]
A staple of PC gaming.  If you haven't played it, your gamer status is in danger of being revoked, so fix this immediately.  It and its episodic sequels are some of the greatest contributions to the video gaming world and simultaneously, its greatest tragedy, as we will never know the end of this amazing storyline.

[h1]The long of it:[/h1]
No, seriously, you don't need to read this review anymore.  Just play the game so you can join the legions of frustrated people who want to throw both money and rotten apples at Valve Software all at the same time.
I would not consider anyone a "gamer" if they haven't played through the entirety of Half-Life 2. You can't know a good game without knowing the godfather of all games.

Никогда не нравилась мне именно эта часть из серии. Помню восторг от красивой графики в 2005, помню восхищение физикой и гравипушкой. И помню жуткое разочарование скучным геймплеем, многочисленными однообразными городскими локациями-коридорами и сценарием для галочки. Сколько бы раз я не пытался перепройти игру, уже повзрослев, в надежде изменить своё мнение о "шедевре" - так и не смог ни разу дойти до конца. Всё ещё красивая, даже сейчас, графика. Всё ещё крутая, по современным мерками, физика. И по прежнему скучный геймплей, унылые однообразные локации и сюжет для галочки.
Amazing for its time

Para resumir todo esta joya en una sola palabra es Perfecta. Half Life 2, un juego donde te sorprenderá, su historia, modo de juego, su buen uso del motor gráfico Source, la inteligencia de los bots, sus logros, son tanta cosas que lo hace único, Half Life 2 hace que tu sientas parte de esta historia, que seas el protagonista. Por primera vez, este juego te hará responsable de tus acciones, si haces todo lo posible para lograr la victoria o simplemente te quedarás estancado. Si estas dispuesto a superar todo, sin importar la dificultad, Half Life 2 es lo tuyo. Siempre habrá algo que te sorprenda este juego, siemrpre habrá algo que te dificultará las cosas, siempre habra algo que siempre lo seguirás amando a este juego. Half Life 2...

Classic! Addictive! Yes it's the game of the generation ! Must play and a big value for money. Bought the game during steam sales from the orange pack bundle. Worth the penny, half life 2 will make you aww with its amazing adventurous story.
